TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit VirtualPathData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents information about the route and virtual path that are the result of generating a URL with the ASP.NET routing framework.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you generate a URL by using the ASP.NET routing framework, an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData> class is returned by the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A> method. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData> class contains information about the route that matched the values that you provided when you called the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A> method. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData> object also contains the generated URL in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData.VirtualPath%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData.DataTokens%2A> property contains custom values for the route. You retrieve the route object that is used for generating the URL by using the <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData.Route%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows a control that creates a URL that is based on a route that has parameters that are named `action` and `categoryName`.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes/cs/Default.aspx.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes/vb/Default.aspx.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of custom values for the route definition.
Docs.value: A collection of custom values for a route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData.DataTokens%2A> property to retrieve values that are associated with the route, but that are not used to determine whether a route matches a URL pattern. These values can be used by the route handler to process the request.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL that was created from the route definition.
Docs.value: The URL that was generated from a route.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To generate a URL, you call the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A> method. That method returns an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData> class, which contains information about the route. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData.VirtualPath%2A> property contains the generated URL.
## Examples The following example shows a control that creates a URL based on a route that has parameters that are named `action` and `categoryName`.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes/cs/Default.aspx.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Routing.RouteTable.Routes/vb/Default.aspx.vb#2)]
